original: Johansson, Bror Harry, läroverksadjunkt, Växjö, f. 28/5/06 i Ljungby, Hall. 1., av Alfred Nilsson o. Emma Bengtsson. — Stud :ex. 26, fil. ämb:-ex. 29. Res. t. Tyskl. 33, 35, 37 o. 39. Vik. adj. i Varberg 31-32, e. o. lektor i Karlstad 32-33, vik. adj. i Norrköp. 33-34, 1 Hälsingborg 34-35, e. adj. där 36-37, e. o. adj. i Linköp. 38-40, adj. i modersm. o. tyska v. Växjö h. a. 1. sed. 40.
translated: Johansson, Bror Harry, high school teacher, Växjö, b. May 28, 1906 in Ljungby, Halland, Sweden, the first child of Alfred Nilsson and Emma Bengtsson. He graduated from college in 1926 and obtained his degree in philosophy in 1929. He traveled to Germany in 1933, 1935, 1937 and 1939. He served as a substitute teacher in Varberg from 1931-1932, acting lecturer in Karlstad from 1932-1933, substitute teacher in Norrköping from 1933-1934, in Helsingborg from 1934-1935, permanent lecturer in Helsingborg from 1936-1937, acting and assistant lecturer in Linköping from 1938-1940, and permanent lecturer in Swedish and German at Växjö from 1940 until his retirement. He married in 19xx, but his partner's name is not provided in the abbreviated biography.

education.description: Studied at a college, graduated in 1926 and obtained a degree in philosophy in 1929.

jobHistory.roleName: Permanent lecturer in Swedish and German
